column2: Working alongside our generalist consultants, Bains Advanced Analytics Group (AAG) helps clients across industries solve their biggest problems using our expertise in data science, customer insights, statistics, machine learning, data management, supply chain analytics and data engineering   Stationed in our global offices, AAG team members hold advanced degrees in computer science, engineering, AI, data science, physics, statistics, mathematics, and other quantitative disciplines, with backgrounds in a variety of fields including tech, data science, marketing analytics and academia       WHAT you'll DO       As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a fundamental role on technical decision making, embedded in projects and working with clients of different industries   You will also get your hands dirty writing code to get Machine Learning models working at real world production environments   This role teams up closely with Data Scientists, Impact Leaders, Consultants and Team Leaders to boost, deepen and streamline the development of innovative solutions that respond to high complexity problems       In this role you will:       Provide data science services to Bain case teams and clients worldwide.     Work with other data scientists and case teams to assess client demands and suggest data science methods that provide practical, value-added answers to the client and case teams.     Develop solutions that bring critical insights to wide scale of different problems such as targeting customers and segmenting markets, product design, marketing optimization, demand forecasting and brand valuation, profit and price analyses, and fraud detection.     Develop, prototype and test machine learning algorithms on data sets that can range from a few data points to billions.     Apply machine learning and statistical techniques including regression models, decision trees, random forests, gradient boosting, support vector machines, clustering and topic models.     Prepare various sources of data using data wrangling methods in Python, R and SQL, leveraging infrastructure including Cloud computing solutions and relational database environments.     Keep abreast of new and current statistical methodologies, machine learning and data wrangling techniques.       ABOUT YOU       Solid theoretical background on machine learning, ideally practical experience on building and deploying machine learning models.     Write code in Python, embracing good code practices.     Being able to deal with different tasks during the whole Machine Learning life cycle. What kind of tasks? ML model deployment and maintenance, building and using tools for ML monitoring, CI/CD pipeline design, supporting experimentation with ML models, designing and building data pipelines, among others.     You have experience working with cloud infrastructure.     You are familiar with the lifecycle of a Machine Learning model.     You are familiar with Containers.     You can build a service that exposes a ML Learning model to be consumed by other applications.     You love teaching others and sharing good practices.     You like getting your hands dirty with new tools and languages. Sometimes it is better to take a risk and learn something new, rather than choosing the good old hammer you always use. It doesn t matter if you take more time, it is an investment for the future.     You like being versatile. You get bored when every day looks the same, so you like sometimes getting dressed as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer or Software Engineer.     Constant collaboration with your teammates.     Provide and accept frequent feedback.     Be autonomous within a collaborative environment.     Find the best and unique version of yourself and boost it!     You have 1 or more years of experience and/or a relevant graduate degree.     A masters Degree or Ph.D. in in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Econometrics, Business Analytics, or Market Research. Previous work experience in a related field is a plus.     Strong foundation in Mathematics and Statistics     Proficiency with data wrangling, visualization and modeling in either R or Python is required     Proficiency in SQL is a plus     Examples of domain expertise in which we are interested is: predictive modeling, churn analysis, time series forecasting, computer vision, text mining, recommender systems, market basket analysis, segmentation, graph analytics, natural language processing and text analytics     Experience with Git and modern software development workflow is a plus     Strong interpersonal and communication skills are pre-requisite for this role     Ability to explain and discuss mathematical and machine learning technicalities to a business audience     Must thrive in a fast-paced environment     Travel required (40-60%)

column2: The   Manager, Risk Management, Information Security   position will be an integral member of the Information Security and Risk Management team    This role will be responsible for design, development, implementation and monitoring of risk management program    Work in Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) office under Director, Information Security Governance, Risk and Compliance, this role serves as an information security technology professional for Grant Thornton to support the design, implementation, and maintenance of a cohesive information security governance, risk and compliance program    The successful candidate will have a good mix of deep technical knowledge, understanding of industry best practice, frameworks and regulations, and a demonstrated background in information security risk management program       An experienced and motivated risk and compliance individual contributor is needed to work across a matrixed team in place today and growing in the future. The successful candidate has a track record of developing strong relationships, collaborating across teams, coordinating multiple timelines, and managing complex, cross discipline projects.        The ideal candidate:    is a self-starter, with the ability to drive tasks to completion independently and learn new skills on the job as program requirements evolve.    possesses strong business judgment, deep analytical thinking, is comfortable managing multiple responsibilities within a fast-paced environment, and has worked collaboratively with others to develop, implement, and communicate business improvement and innovative strategies.    possesses strong verbal and written communication skills, a solution-oriented approach, and relationship-building skills are important attributes to succeed in this role.    global view of their business and think in terms of immediate problem solving but also automating, expanding, and scaling solutions broadly.    thinks strategically at a global level and effectively develop key processes, procedures and communications that facilitate cross-functional implementation of risk management processes and risk reporting.     Responsibilities:      Develop the information security risk management framework and risk appetite    Collaborate and partner with Enterprise Risk Management function to gain alignment and advance the program    Perform information security risk assessments across a variety of platforms and applications    Perform information security supplier/vendor risk assessments. Utilize the best methods for identifying potential supplier risks.     Prepare risk reports, facilitate risk treatment by proposing remediation/mitigating controls and recommendations to business stakeholders; prepare risk register to monitor and track risks.     Assess exposure to risk, measure operational risk against ERM frameworks, assist in establishing policies and procedures to minimize risk, identify ways to protect the organization from data loss and reputational damage    Support iterative review of assessment results, working with appropriate stakeholders across the lines of defense    Perform and facilitate the collection, review, and assimilation of risk assessment data and reporting into concise and meaningful reports/dashboards for leadership    Remain up to date with emerging threats, best practices and relevant legislation    Work and communicate hand-in-hand with both external and internal stakeholders on critical issues that are directly impacting the business.    Contribute to the development of scalable models and tools that speed up both decision making and accuracy for the organization.    Meet with stakeholders to gather and integrate feedback and evangelize the program    Create metrics and measure progress and compliance. Take leading role in drafting and presenting deep-dive documents, including responses to senior executives.    Provide supply chain security assessment remediation oversight.

column2: Material Program Manager will manage materials planning and CTB (clear to build) process with suppliers and OEMs, ensuring that we have efficient process and clear visibility on our procurement strategy and execution. Your successful ability to partner with OEMs and the sourcing team on material strategy will directly impact on our product success.    The ideal candidate has a passion for supply chain, demonstrated knowledge of industry best practices, and the ability to deliver results as part of a dynamic, cross-functional team.     Job Description     Clear-to-Build (CTB) Management: Provide visibility to materials supply, highlighting projected coverage and constraints. CTB projection govern what the Supply Demand Managers (SDM) can commit to customers and are a key input to revenue projections.   Partner with the CMs to develop a model that incorporates the specific supply chain and materials flow details to project availability in support of our supply/demand goals.   Create allocation strategies for constrained materials by developing models across factories, programs, and lines of business.   Identify Excess and Obsolescence (EO) and other material risk, recommend critical course of action to leadership, and own efforts to mitigate liability to the business.   Develop strategic roadmap for the phase-out of obsolete parts and new product materials.   Prepare and communicate critical materials updates at weekly Sustaining Executive Program reviews; maintain executive reports and summaries, providing accurate and timely data to leadership on a weekly basis.   Through a deep understanding of our commodity terms, ensure the logistical flow of materials necessary to meet production schedules, inventory control requirements, and ongoing material line support.   Onsite CM and sub-tier supplier support.   Partner with vendors, distributors, and CM to expedite shipping of orders whenever necessary, to meet manufacturing deadlines.     Job Requirements     5+ years of experience in supply chain management within a functional role in supply planning, fulfillment, operations management, inventory management, and procurement.   Experience in the development and implementation of Supply Chain Planning systems and processes.   Preferred but not limited to bachelors degree in engineering, a related discipline, or MBA with an emphasis in Supply Chain Management.   Experience with consumer products or electronics Contract Manufacturing.   Experience driving process improvement projects from idea to implementation and adoption.   Experience in hardware product supply chain delivery through the entire life cycle.   Ability to successfully work across multiple levels of the organization with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.   Good command of English.

column2: Minimum Qualification   Any Graduate    Work Experience   5-10Years     Responsibilities :    ?    As an Assistant Manager - Quality, your primary role is to support the overall quality management system within an organization. You will work closely with the Quality Manager or other senior quality professionals to ensure that products, services, and processes meet or exceed quality standards and customer expectations. Here are some key responsibilities typically associated with the role of an Assistant Manager - Quality:   Quality Assurance: Assist in developing, implementing, and maintaining quality assurance processes and procedures. This includes conducting audits, inspections, and assessments to identify areas for improvement and ensure compliance with applicable quality standards and regulations.   Process Improvement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze existing processes and identify opportunities for improvement. Use tools and methodologies such as Lean Six Sigma to streamline processes, reduce waste, and increase efficiency.   Quality Control: Oversee the inspection and testing of products or services to ensure they meet specified requirements. This may involve establishing quality control plans, developing inspection criteria, and coordinating with production or service delivery teams to address any quality issues.   Data Analysis: Collect and analyze data related to quality performance indicators, such as defect rates, customer complaints, and non-conformance incidents. Use statistical techniques and quality management software to identify trends, root causes, and areas for corrective and preventive actions.   Training and Documentation: Assist in developing and delivering quality-related training programs for employees at all levels. Ensure that relevant quality documentation, such as standard operating procedures, work instructions, and quality manuals, are up to date and accessible to the appropriate personnel.   Supplier Management: Collaborate with procurement and supply chain teams to establish and maintain relationships with suppliers. Monitor supplier performance, conduct supplier audits, and address any quality issues or non-compliance concerns.   Continuous Improvement: Promote a culture of continuous improvement by encouraging employees to identify and implement quality enhancement initiatives. Facilitate cross-functional improvement projects, engage in problem-solving activities, and support the development of a quality mindset throughout the organization.   Regulatory Compliance: Stay updated on relevant quality regulations and industry standards to ensure compliance. Assist in preparing for audits and inspections by regulatory bodies, as well as addressing any findings or recommendations.

column2: As a Partnered Data Scientist, you will be responsible for collaborating with external partners and clients to develop data-driven solutions and insights. You will leverage your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling to drive business outcomes and support decision-making processes. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will contribute to the development and implementation of advanced analytics projects, ensuring that they align with the strategic goals and objectives of the organization.       Responsibilities:        Collaborate with external partners and clients to understand their business needs and challenges.       Design and implement data analysis projects to uncover insights and solve complex problems.       Develop predictive models, algorithms, and machine learning techniques to drive business growth and optimize performance.       Conduct thorough data exploration and preprocessing to ensure data quality and reliability.       Apply statistical analysis and hypothesis testing to validate and interpret findings.       Communicate complex technical concepts and analytical results to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.       Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, software developers, and business analysts, to integrate data science solutions into existing systems.       Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence technologies.       Collaborate with internal teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data and analytics to improve business processes and decision-making.       Maintain documentation and provide training to ensure knowledge transfer and cross-functional collaboration.          Requirements:       Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. A Master's degree or Ph.D. is preferred.     Proven experience as a data scientist or in a similar role, preferably in a collaborative or client-facing capacity.     Strong knowledge of data analysis, statistical modeling, machine learning algorithms, and predictive analytics.     Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Scala, and experience working with data analysis libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn).     Familiarity with database systems, SQL, and data manipulation techniques.     Solid understanding of experimental design and hypothesis testing.     Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to apply analytical methods to real-world challenges.     Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex concepts and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.     Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.     Strong collaboration and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional environments.     Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.     Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.       Benefits     What a Consulting role at Thoucentric will offer you?                     Opportunity to define your career path and not as enforced by a manager                             A great consulting environment with a chance to work with Fortune 500 companies and startups alike.                             A dynamic but relaxed and supportive working environment that encourages personal development.                             Be part of One Extended Family. We bond beyond work - sports, get-togethers, common interests etc.                             Work in a very enriching environment with Open Culture, Flat Organization and Excellent Peer Group.                             Be part of the exciting Growth Story of Thoucentric!

column2: As our Digital Technical Authority for our Global Technology Centre (GTC) in India, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful delivery of projects by shaping and executing our organization s technical strategy. Your expertise will guide critical decisions, ensuring that our projects align with industry best practices, innovation, and quality standards. You ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, providing technical leadership and fostering a culture of excellence.   The Digital practice in the GTC consists of three practices Enabling Services, Data Intelligence and Technology Solutions. As the Technical Authority you will be the accountable for the technical delivery across all three practices. You will ensure that technical decisions are made with a balanced view of what good looks like, considering the buy, partner, build decision, technical development stack available, and data, security and IP considerations. You will engage heavily in the digital Global Technical Networks (GTNs), shaping these and aligning the GTC accordingly.   Enabling Services encompasses our digital internally managed services that support our wider business. Data Intelligence helps our clients set data strategy and governance, architect and manage their data and generate insight from it through artificial intelligence and powerful visualizations. Technology Solutions is our end-to-end service to help our clients integrate, deliver and run high quality technology their people embrace.   You will need to work with the Practice Leads in India, whilst collaborating closely with counterparts in our global regions to instill technical rigor into our development processes, coaching and mentoring junior staff so they are able to make better technical decisions day to day, whilst being the ultimate stop for more complex decisions.   This is a part-time team leadership role, and you will have a non-productive allowance to balance alongside your wider project delivery.    Accountabilities    You will be empowered to drive the success of Digital Practice, working collaboratively with colleagues across the Practice and wider business to shape and deliver the technical direction of the business. Specifically, you will have a big personal impact to:    Develop and communicate a clear technical vision aligned with business goals, identifying emerging trends, technologies, and opportunities to enhance our technical capabilities.   Mentor and inspire technical teams, promoting a growth mindset and continuous learning, setting technical standards, guidelines, and best practices across projects which drive innovation.   Collaborate with Technical leadership from across the business, including the GTC Practice Leads and Global Technical Networks (GTNs) to develop, implement, and embed technical best practice into BAU delivery, liaising with regional capabilities to highlight opportunities to use novel technologies.   Scope the technical solutions for our complex and/or high-risk projects, drawing on your industry experience to terminate strategic decisions that allow re-use, optimize delivery efficiency and comply to internal and external standards (e.g. security, data residency, preferred suppliers etc.).   Proactively monitor and appropriately manage technical delivery risks, with a focus on protecting the GTC reputation with the wider business and our clients, solving and learning from issues as they arise.   Streamline interfaces with other Practice areas, both within the GTC and more broadly, to enable high value integrated propositions, identifying complementary expertise and aligning ways of working to reduce barriers.     Person profile    You will be an experienced and excellent leader in providing a consultancy service to help teams optimize their overall program delivery using digital products and services. Beyond that, you will:    Have a track record in setting and implementing strategy for a high performing service.   Relish nurturing, developing and motivating teams to deliver excellence and realize growth.   Care passionately about delighting clients through a collaborative style and quality delivery.   Give behavior and culture at least as much emphasis as technical skills development.   Think innovatively and creatively about the best way to solve clients problems.   Be commercially astute, leveraging internal resource, intellectual property and supply chain.   Communicate complex technical subjects clearly and concisely with a focus on benefits.    Keep abreast of the latest technical developments, and be able to integrate these into our delivery.   You will be able to demonstrate the following experience, skills, and qualifications:    Bachelor s degree in computer science or other relevant field (practical experience in lieu will be considered).   Extensive experience in overseeing the design and development of large applications, including application development processes and quality control while coordinating multiple programmers.   Extensive experience with current programming techniques, development tools, database design and/or administration of enterprise relational database management systems.   Demonstrable experience operating using excellent interpersonal, technical writing and communications skills.   An industry recognized certification, i.e., Microsoft Certified Solution Developer desired, or equivalent.

column2: Job DetailsAre you an innovative product manager who thrives in a fast paced collaborative environment and loves working with the best technology team in the world?How about Salesforce Industries? Are you excited about building features that scale multiple industries, accelerate our growth, think big but still make sure the product fulfills needs of multiple industries?The Salesforce Industries Team is looking for a top Product Management professional to drive the next set of Manufacturing & Automotive industry-specific functionality to accelerate our growth.We've already started, and are looking for someone who can synthesize the industry requirements and build into a foundation layer for the industries cloud.We are also looking for a Salesforce know-it-all, or someone who wants to become just that. Much of our mandate is to extend core Salesforce offerings into Industry specific use cases, so they work out-of-the-box and incorporate best practices from around the industry, as well as drawing inspiration from mind-blowing innovations from other industries.ResponsibilitiesHere's what you would be doing :- Own our Manufacturing and Automotive product Point of View and directional roadmap including how it works with leverages partner integrations.- Own and drive the vision strategy roadmap development for industry specific solutions- Work with PMs in other clouds like IoT, Einstein, etc to identify what we can leverage extend optimize for industries- Work with our Industries experts to define the next business problem to solve that brings multiplier effect for our team- Engage with customers, partners, and ISVs, along with product ambassadors from across Salesforce to prioritize the right features- Represent Salesforce as a product expert at customer interactions, industry and corporate events, and through community sites and social media.First and foremost :- Experience in product management in one or more of CRM, supply chain, manufacturing, pricing and automotive verticals and or management with expertise in enterprise SaaS environments- Demonstrable experience in building enterprise SaaS products (10+ years experience)- Understand the Manufacturing , Supply Chain , Sales , Service & Commerce Domains and how all the key end to end solutions drive business value to the customers- Passion to solve customer problems and build products that delights customers- Enterprise architecture comprehension and experience- Strong Product Management skills- Fast learner with the ability to quickly learn new technologies and domains- Ability to work in a team of other PMs who have dependencies on you and vice versa. Others would leverage much of what you work on with corresponding needs for their functionality.Everything else that matters :- Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related disciplines or equivalent experience in technical roles- Experience in building proven solutions of enterprise grade and scale- Agile methodology, and API experience- MBA a plus- Industry certifications such as APICS CPIM, CSCP, CTL a plus

column1: CA or CPA + TECH + FASB+ GAAP For Lease Accounting
column2: Tango s system implementation and support follows the process of requirements, design, configure/ build, test and remediate, deploy, and support. Client support is offered to Tango s global clients 24/7. The Services and Support teams in the Bangalore office work directly with Tango s US based teams and with clients across the globe.      Lease accounting standards are changing, and our company offers solutions that assist companies with that change. The candidate will become part of the accounting team group of subject matter experts (SME). As such, the candidate will be expected to assist the services team with implementing the Tango Lease Administration SaaS product as well as assist the support team with resolving live client issues and concerns. Our clients include Fortune 500 companies with a global reach.   As an accounting subject matter expert, you will be responsible for but not limited to:   Tango Services - Accounting    Configuration - Clients will have questions about how to achieve accounting treatments in Tango. As a SME you will have to carefully tread the line between accounting consulting and explaining how Tango technology can assist the client to achieve their desired accounting result. Then you will advise the implementation team as to how to configure Tango in order to assist the client in achieving that result.   Business Process Definition With new accounting and new systems, clients will struggle to realize how business processes may need to change, or even the need for new business processes. You will help clients realize the gaps in their accounting business process and provide guidance about how to develop a process that works with Tango.   Reporting - Clients sometimes have reporting requirements that are specific to their own accounting needs. You will help gather the requirements of their reporting needs and work with technical leads and report writers to create reports that meet their needs. Where multiple reports can be used to achieve the same effect, you will offer that as a solution first.    Integrations - Clients do accounting in a lot of different ways. Their GL information is broken out in lot of different ways. You will work with technical leads and with integration writers in order to send accounting information to the client so that their system can process it correctly.    Tango Client Support - Accounting     General - Once the implementation is complete, the client will be live with using Tango s lease system in order to both administer a lease and to account for those transactions. You will assist support by answering client questions as to how to use the Tango system to resolve their difficulties.    User error - Identify when the client is not using the product according to design, either to Tango specifications in general, or according to their specific configuration / implementation and use of the system.    Identification of bugs Identify when the system is not performing according to design with respect to accounting items; Tango system, integrations, reports, etc.    Identify source of error   Propose solutions / calculation changes   Create development tickets   Requests for enhancements   Identify when the client is requesting an enhancement to the system   Describe requested enhancements   Possibly assist in detailed requirement gathering for the enhancement   Tango Development Activities   Bug Fixes   Enhancements to Functionality   Creation of calculation models   Creation of standard reports   Creation of business process models   Regression testing Understand lease accounting and be able to determine if all calculations in Tango are behaving as expected with regard to accounting standards    Other tasks    Creation of amortization tables using time value of money software, or Excel.   The use of internal IP i.e. Excel models, for the generation of accounting schedules using amortization tables.   Reviewing results of accounting schedules for internal and external validation   Research accounting topics and become an expert in limited timeframes   Support consultants as needed   Support management as needed       Qualifications      Excellent financial accounting skills   Demonstrate the ability to reason and problem solve using accounting information   Excellent knowledge of both FASB and IFRS Lease standards    ?
column13: Business process, Accounting, Analytical, Reconciliation, Consulting, GAAP, Leasing, Client support, IFRS, Macros

They are held responsible for all business and supplier support for purchasing and invoicing including supplier set up.    Catalogue creation, including creation of BPA, CPAs and Punchout, this includes the build and implementation of procurement catalogs for assigned categories of spend (iProcurement).    Running reports as requested from ERP System and / or Spend Analytics Tool    Review reporting for non-compliance and either solution in system or work with business to resolve    On-boarding vendors to iSupplier/e-invoicing portal including providing login information, training, and technical support    Lead Business trainings for all purchasing support and guidance    Creation of requisitions/purchase orders for the business    Creation of inventory, expense, and capital items    Support and resolution of purchasing queries form the business    Performs UAT (User Acceptance Test) testing for Procurement and Inventory modules in support of upgrades and enhancements    Work with EP and the Business to set up new suppliers for payment and purchasing    Build of new inventory organizations and associated tasks such as inventory item and stock locator creation and assignment    Interfaces with business partners and suppliers within and outside of GS&P to resolve purchasing and operational issues    Ensuring the business utilizes processes for Procurement Compliance while continually monitoring compliance    Is the SME (Subject Matter Expert) for all the buyers. Ensuring that all buyers follow purchasing policy and procedures    Responsible for the development and training of all buyers in all technical, system skills, procurement compliance and standards. This includes providing regular purchasing training to the business.?    Provides all provisioning of the buyers responsibilities within the ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system.    Manages and resolution of all tickets submitted through the Service Now System.    Oversees all the purchasing for New Stores, Relocations and Remodels in the United States. This includes ensuring timely procurement of goods and communication to suppliers in support of these stores as well as issue resolution      What you will need:       We seek self-motivated colleagues who can demonstrate their talent and experience to identify, triage, and support the smooth operation of Procurement activity and initiatives. You will work with our finest thought leaders to correlate ongoing efforts with key business outcomes.    Ability to build relationships remotely and become a trusted advisor    Drives for results. Wants to drive efficiencies and is target orientated    Proactive communication    Design processes    Test systems      Minimum Qualifications:       2 years in sourcing, procurement, supply management or related experience    Expertise on purchasing processes    Excellent communication skills with the ability to build and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners    Strong training & development skills    Experience in ticket issue and resolution systems    Experience in invoicing processes and e-invoicing system    Strong presentation skills with experience presenting information to the business    Basic knowledge of Microsoft 365 Suite proficiency (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)      Preferred Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Sourcing or Supply Management, business or finance is desirable but not essential    Experience in the retail industry and managing multinational Business Partners and suppliers    Worked with Oracle ERP for purchasing, inventory and/or invoicing processes

Supplier Relationships:   Develop and maintain relationships with   e-auction platform providers  , staying abreast of industry trends and advancements in e-procurement technology.          Reporting and Communication:   Prepare   comprehensive reports and presentations   to communicate e-auction results, savings achievements, and recommendations to senior management and key stakeholders. Familiarity with e-sourcing/e-auction platforms and procurement technologies:   Prior experience with platforms such as   Ariba, Jaegger, etc   will be advantageous.          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills:   Emphasize the importance of   clear communication and collaboration   in engaging with internal stakeholders and suppliers.          Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality:   Highlight the need for   meticulous attention to detail   and a dedication to delivering high-quality work.          Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment:   Seek candidates who can   thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment  , balancing competing demands and meeting tight deadlines. column2: Assistant Purchase Managers provide support to the procurement or purchasing department within an organization    They assist in managing the procurement process, sourcing suppliers, and ensuring the timely acquisition of goods and services needed by the company     Here are the key responsibilities of an Assistant Purchase Manager:     Sourcing Suppliers: Assistant Purchase Managers help identify and evaluate potential suppliers or vendors    They research and compare suppliers based on factors such as price, quality, delivery times, and terms of service    They may also negotiate contracts and establish relationships with suppliers    Purchase Order Processing: They assist in generating purchase orders based on approved requisitions or orders from internal stakeholders    They ensure accuracy and completeness of purchase orders, including the item specifications, quantities, delivery dates, and pricing information    Inventory Management: Assistant Purchase Managers monitor inventory levels and collaborate with relevant departments to determine stock requirements    They maintain accurate records of stock levels, track inventory movement, and coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely replenishment    Supplier Relationship Management: They work closely with suppliers, maintaining effective communication channels and addressing any issues or concerns that may arise    They may participate in supplier performance evaluations, quality audits, and contract negotiations to ensure optimal supplier performance    Price and Contract Negotiation: Assistant Purchase Managers assist in negotiating pricing, terms, and contracts with suppliers to secure favorable agreements for the organization    They may collaborate with senior purchasing managers or procurement officers during negotiations     Vendor Evaluation and Qualification:     They assist in evaluating potential suppliers and conducting due diligence to assess their capabilities, financial stability, reputation, and compliance with industry regulations    They may also maintain a vendor database with relevant information for future reference    Purchase Requisition Processing: They review and process purchase requisitions from different departments, ensuring they comply with company policies and procedures    They may liaise with requestors to gather additional information and clarify requirements, if necessary    Documentation and Reporting: Assistant Purchase Managers maintain accurate records of procurement activities, such as purchase orders, invoices, contracts, and correspondence with suppliers    They generate reports on procurement performance, supplier evaluations, and cost savings for management review    Compliance and Ethics: They adhere to legal and ethical procurement practices, including compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and company policies    They may assist in ensuring supplier compliance with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards    Continuous Improvement: Assistant Purchase Managers contribute to the improvement of procurement processes and systems by identifying areas for optimization, cost reduction, and efficiency enhancement    They may propose and implement process improvements to streamline procurement operations    Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, negotiation abilities, and knowledge of procurement processes are essential for success as an Assistant Purchase Manager    Additionally, proficiency in using procurement software or enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems is often required to manage purchasing activities effectively

As a Big Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our big data infrastructure.        You will work with large datasets, perform data processing, and support various business functions by creating data pipelines, data processing jobs, and data integration solutions.        You will be working in a dynamic and collaborative environment, leveraging your expertise in Hive, Hadoop, and PySpark to unlock valuable insights from our data.            Key Responsibilities:            Data Ingestion and Integration:        Develop and maintain data ingestion processes to collect data from various sources.           Integrate data from different platforms and databases into a unified data lake.             Data Processing:        Create data processing jobs using Hive and PySpark for large-scale data transformation.           Optimize data processing workflows to ensure efficiency and performance.             Data Pipeline Development:        Design and implement ETL pipelines to move data from raw to processed formats.           Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, ensuring data quality and reliability.             Data Modeling and Optimization:        Develop data models for efficient querying and reporting using Hive.           Implement performance tuning and optimization strategies for Hadoop and Spark.             Data Governance:        Implement data security and access controls to protect sensitive information.           Ensure compliance with data governance policies and best practices.             Collaboration:        Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide data support.                 Qualifications:          Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.         3+ years of experience in big data engineering and data processing.         Proficiency in Hive, Hadoop, and PySpark.         Strong SQL and NoSQL database experience.         Experience with data warehousing and data modeling.         Knowledge of data integration, ETL processes, and data quality.         Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.         Excellent communication and teamwork skills.          Preferred Qualifications:          Experience with cloud-based big data technologies (e.g., AWS EMR, Azure HDInsight, Google Dataprep).         Certification in Hadoop, Hive, or PySpark.         Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).         Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

column2: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Complaint Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing excellent customer service, ensuring that the Complaints Team resolve all complaints efficiently, effectively, in a timely manner.       Job Responsibilities:    The role involves managing complaints and ensuring quality standards within medical and pharmaceutical departments.    Responsibilities include receiving and investigating complaints from consumers and CMOs via CRM platforms like NetSuite and SAP.    The specialist will log complaints, conduct investigations to identify defects, and in next steps he/she will ensure proper communication with CMOs & prepare documentation for FDA investigation and audits.    Documentation will include things like lot numbers, product details, allergic complaint etc.    On an average, 20 complaints are received monthly, forwarded by CMOs and consumers both.    Experience in handling manufacturing complaints in pharmaceutical and medical sectors with strict regulations is preferred.    Strong communication skills are required to handle consumer calls and effectively communicate with CMOs.    Attendance at FDA meetings and audits is non-negotiable, as it is a priority for the company.     Job Requirements:    Degree in the life sciences or equivalent qualification, with 5+ years of QA experience    Strong knowledge of US FDA regulation such as 21 CFR, 210, 211, 820 and other regulatory standards    Fluency in English; as well as strong and organizational skills    Must have a laptop/ PC and good Internet connectivity.
